TITLE: AI won an art contest, and artists are furious
SUMMARY: Jason M. Allen was almost too nervous to enter his first art competition. Now, his award-winning image is sparking controversy about whether art can be generated by a computer, and what, exactly, it means to be an artist.

TITLE: How airlines give you internet access at 35,000 feet — and why it still needs a lot of work
SUMMARY: Flights used to be a chance to sit back (albeit a bit cramped) and watch a recently released movie or catch up on some reading. Now they're just another place to log on.

TITLE: US internet service company blocks controversial online forum citing 'imminent threats to human life'
SUMMARY: Cloudflare, a major American internet services company, pulled its support for Kiwi Farms, a controversial online message board, Saturday evening citing "imminent threats to human life." The move temporarily forced Kiwi Farms offline.

TITLE: Instagram fined $400 million for failing to protect children's data
SUMMARY: Ireland's data privacy regulator has agreed to levy a record fine of 405 million euros ($402 million) against social network Instagram following an investigation into its handling of children's data, a spokesperson for the watchdog said.

TITLE: What to expect at Apple's 'far out' iPhone 14 event
SUMMARY: Apple is expected to debut its iPhone 14 lineup at the company's annual September keynote event on Wednesday.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes asks court for a new trial after alleging a key witness has regrets
SUMMARY: Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of failed blood testing startup Theranos who was convicted of fraud earlier this year, is asking for a new trial after claiming that a key witness visited her house unannounced and allegedly said he "feels guilty" about his testimony.

TITLE: Here's why it's taking NASA so long to attempt another Artemis I launch
SUMMARY: NASA has a plan for repairs to the massive new moon rocket after its latest attempt to launch an uncrewed test mission. It will be at least a few weeks before the rocket can make its next attempt. Here's why.

TITLE: Trans activist celebrates rare victory against online trolls after Kiwi Farms deplatforming
SUMMARY: Clara Sorrenti, a trans activist who was forced to flee her home in Canada after users of a hate-filled website targeted her, has succeeded in her campaign to get the site taken offline, for now.

TITLE: Japan is using snow to cool a data center
SUMMARY: A city in Japan has found a way to cool the vast servers that support the global digital economy without fueling the climate crisis.

TITLE: Apple set to unveil iPhone 14 at 'far out' event
SUMMARY: Apple is set to hold its big September press event where the company is widely expected to unveil the iPhone 14 lineup. Follow live here

TITLE: Judge denies Elon Musk's request to delay Twitter trial following whistleblower disclosure
SUMMARY: A Delaware judge on Wednesday denied Elon Musk's request to delay his trial with Twitter over their $44 billion acquisition deal after a former top executive alleged the company has serious security vulnerabilities.

TITLE: These companies are looking at using rockets to blast cargo across the planet
Apple unveils iPhone 14 at 'far out' event
SUMMARY: Apple held its big September press event where the company unveiled the iPhone 14 lineup, a new Apple Ultra watch and more. Follow live here.

TITLE: Apple announces satellite emergency SOS feature for iPhone 14
SUMMARY: Apple announced a forthcoming satellite connectivity feature called Emergency SOS via Satellite at its iPhone 14 launch event. The tool is intended to help people using the company's next-generation phones to communicate when their cell service isn't working — a process that Apple said took years to make a reality.

TITLE: Apple unveils new iPhones, Apple Watches and AirPods
SUMMARY: Apple unveiled its new iPhone 14 lineup at a press event on Wednesday, along with three new Apple Watch models, an update to its popular AirPods product line and a feature that could save lives when cell service isn't available.

TITLE: Amazon has no plan to make workers return to the office, CEO Andy Jassy says
SUMMARY: Amazon CEO Andy Jassy isn't looking to force the company's workers back into the office anytime soon.

TITLE: Amazon stops selling seatbelt alarm defeat devices in India
SUMMARY: Amazon has stopped selling devices that can disable seatbelt alarms in India following a request from the government.

TITLE: Russians will be able to buy the iPhone 14
SUMMARY: Russians will have the chance to buy the new Apple iPhone 14, despite the US tech company having left the country, thanks to Moscow's parallel import scheme, a senior government official told the RIA Novosti news agency on Thursday.

TITLE: Disney believed Twitter had 'substantial' numbers of fake accounts when it weighed acquisition in 2016, ex-CEO says
SUMMARY: Disney's analysis of Twitter in connection with a potential 2016 acquisition led the entertainment giant to conclude that "substantial" numbers of accounts on the social media service were fake, according to former Disney CEO Bob Iger.

TITLE: Amazon will stop selling seatbelt alarm defeat devices in India
SUMMARY: Amazon will halt the sale of devices that can disable seatbelt alarms in India following a request from the government.

TITLE: Apple's latest products and features take aim at our greatest fears
SUMMARY: If you only tuned into the opening of Apple's iPhone event this week, you might have wondered whether you were watching an emergency first responder training session.

TITLE: NASA eyes two dates in late September for Artemis I launch but several hurdles remain
SUMMARY: NASA has two new date in mind — September 23 or September 27 — for the next attempt at launching its massive new moon rocket on an uncrewed test mission. But there are still several hurdles that could stand in the way, any of which could push the launch date back further.

TITLE: Amazon will halt the sale of seatbelt alarm defeat devices in India
SUMMARY: Amazon will halt the sale of devices that can disable seatbelt alarms in India following a request from the government.

TITLE: Trump media merger isn't dead yet after deal gets a lifeline
SUMMARY: Digital World Acquisition Corp., the blank-check firm seeking to merge with former President Donald Trump's media venture, announced Friday it will avoid an imminent liquidation.

TITLE: Tesla considering lithium refinery in Texas, seeks tax relief
SUMMARY: Tesla Inc (TSLA) is considering setting up a lithium refinery on the gulf coast of Texas, as it looks to secure supply of the key component used in batteries amid surging demand for electric vehicles.

TITLE: Apple is ditching physical SIM cards. Here's what you should know
SUMMARY: The days of using a paper clip to perform microsurgery to extract a tiny SIM card from a little tray in your iPhone may be coming to an end.

TITLE: Why wireless carriers are offering the new iPhone for 'free'
SUMMARY: The unveiling of the latest iPhone 14 lineup earlier this week has already spurred a flurry of new promotions from wireless giants including AT&T, T-Mobile and Verizon.

TITLE: Blue Origin 'responding to an issue' after abort system activated on uncrewed launch
SUMMARY: Blue Origin experienced an "anomaly" during an uncrewed launch of its New Shepard rocket from West Texas on Monday morning, triggering an abort system that allowed the capsule to parachute to Earth.

TITLE: Blue Origin rocket experiences 'booster failure,' activates abort system during uncrewed launch
SUMMARY: A Blue Origin rocket experienced a "booster failure" during an uncrewed launch of its New Shepard rocket from West Texas on Monday morning, triggering an abort system that allowed the capsule to parachute to Earth.

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower is set to testify on Capitol Hill. Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is set to testify before Congress Tuesday in his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations against the social media company were reported last month by CNN and The Washington Post.

TITLE: Twitter pushes back at Elon Musk's attempt to exit deal over purported whistleblower payout
SUMMARY: Twitter on Monday pushed back at a new attempt by Elon Musk to walk away from their $44 billion acquisition deal over a payment the company is said to have made to a former employee who later turned whistleblower, calling the billionaire's move "invalid and wrongful."

TITLE: Extreme California heat knocks key Twitter data center offline
SUMMARY: Extreme heat in California has left Twitter without one of its key data centers, and a company executive warned in an internal memo obtained by CNN that another outage elsewhere could result in the service going dark for some of its users.

TITLE: Apple iOS 16 is now available for download
SUMMARY: Apple on Monday released its next-generation mobile software, iOS 16, with new features that allow users to personalize their iPhone lock screens and change how they text friends through iMessage.

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower goes to Congress to warn of global security threats
SUMMARY: Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is set to testify before Congress Tuesday in his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations against the social media company were reported last month by CNN and The Washington Post.

TITLE: US lawmakers question Twitter on security practices on eve of whistleblower testimony
SUMMARY: US lawmakers sent Twitter more than a dozen questions about its security practices Monday, on the eve of a company whistleblower's testimony before Congress in which he is expected to outline damning allegations of security and privacy vulnerabilities at the embattled social media company.

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower set to testify before Senate committee
SUMMARY: In his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations were first reported, Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is set to testify before Congress at 10 a.m. ET today. He has alleged Twitter has undisclosed security and privacy vulnerabilities. Follow live here

TITLE: Twitter's whistleblower testifies before Senate committee
SUMMARY: In his first public appearance since his bombshell allegations were first reported, Twitter whistleblower Peiter "Mudge" Zatko is testifying before Congress today. He has alleged Twitter has undisclosed security and privacy vulnerabilities. Follow live here

TITLE: Uber and its subsidiary pay New Jersey $100 million in back taxes
SUMMARY: Uber and one of its subsidiaries paid $100 million to New Jersey after an audit by the state's Department of Labor and Workforce Development determined the ride-share company improperly classified hundreds of thousands of drivers as independent contractors.

TITLE: Twitter shareholders vote in favor of Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover deal
SUMMARY: Elon Musk may be fighting tooth-and-nail to get out of his deal to buy Twitter, but the social media company's shareholders plan to hold him to it.

TITLE: Twitter is unable to catch and remove foreign agents in its ranks, whistleblower testifies
SUMMARY: Twitter lacks the resources and motivation to search for and remove foreign intelligence threats within its operations even as it has received warnings of possible spies in its ranks, former head of security Peiter "Mudge" Zatko told lawmakers in his first public appearance since blowing the whistle on the company.

TITLE: Twitter shareholders vote overwhelmingly in favor of Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover deal
SUMMARY: Elon Musk may be fighting tooth-and-nail to get out of his deal to buy Twitter, but the social media company's shareholders plan to hold him to it.

TITLE: Google loses appeal against record $4 billion EU fine
SUMMARY: Google suffered one of its biggest setbacks on Wednesday when a top European court fined it 4.125 billion euros ($4.13 billion) for using its Android mobile operating system to thwart rivals, offering a precedent for other regulators to ratchet up pressure.

TITLE: California AG sues Amazon over allegedly anticompetitive pricing contracts
SUMMARY: California's attorney general sued Amazon on Wednesday, alleging the company has forced third-party sellers to offer only their lowest prices in listings with the e-commerce giant and harming competition in the process.

TITLE: TikTok won't commit to stopping US data flows to China
SUMMARY: TikTok repeatedly declined to commit to US lawmakers on Wednesday that the short-form video app will cut off flows of US user data to China, instead promising that the outcome of its negotiations with the US government "will satisfy all national security concerns."

TITLE: The world's second biggest cryptocurrency just got a lot greener
SUMMARY: Ethereum, the world's second most valuable cryptocurrency, has completed a massive software upgrade that its backers claim will slash its carbon footprint.

TITLE: UK launches deeper antitrust probe of Microsoft's Activision deal
SUMMARY: UK officials have launched a deeper antitrust investigation into Microsoft's $68.7 billion purchase of video game giant Activision Blizzard, reflecting concerns that the deal may lead to reduced competition.

TITLE: Zoom hit by brief outage
SUMMARY: Zoom was hit by a brief outage Thursday morning, potentially disrupting some of the many users who have come to rely on it for meetings during the pandemic.

TITLE: Adobe builds collaborative design muscle with $20 billion deal for Figma
SUMMARY: Adobe Inc will buy startup Figma for about $20 billion in its biggest deal, the Photoshop maker said on Thursday, bulking up on applications that support online collaboration amid a global shift to hybrid working.

TITLE: You could soon receive even more emails after shopping on Amazon
SUMMARY: If you've ever worried you weren't getting enough emails from businesses trying to sell you things, you're in luck.

TITLE: TikTok clones rival with real-time sharing feature
SUMMARY: After years of larger competitors copying TikTok, the short-form video app is now copying a newer rival.

TITLE: Amazon is about to stream its first 'Thursday Night Football' game. Here's what will change
SUMMARY: Amazon is about to make its "Thursday Night Football" streaming debut, and it's hoping to enhance the broadcast experience enough to keep viewers coming back.

TITLE: Elon Musk has publicly filed updated counterclaims against Twitter based on whistleblower disclosure
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's legal team on Thursday filed a public version of its updated counterclaims in response to Twitter's lawsuit seeking to force the billionaire to follow through with his $44 billion deal to buy the company.

TITLE: California Gov. Newsom signs landmark legislation aimed at boosting children's safety online
SUMMARY: A landmark California bill aimed at promoting children's digital welfare became law on Thursday, as Gov. Gavin Newsom announced he had signed the legislation imposing strict requirements on websites "likely to be accessed" by kids.

TITLE: Uber investigating 'cybersecurity incident' after hacker claims to access internal systems
SUMMARY: Uber said Thursday that it was investigating a "cybersecurity incident" after a hacker shared evidence that they had breached the ride-hailing giant's computer systems with journalists and security researchers.

TITLE: The biggest change to the new iPhone isn't the hardware
SUMMARY: When iPhone 14 users aren't using their new Apple device, the screen is hardly asleep. It'll remain lit with prominently displayed widgets such as alarms, calendar appointments and sports scores flittering with real-time updates, and be at the ready if you glance down or inevitably pick it back up.

TITLE: At Twitter whistleblower hearing, a key tech regulator comes under fire
SUMMARY: When a Twitter whistleblower testified at an explosive Senate hearing this week, the social media company wasn't the only one to come under fire. Lawmakers on both sides of the aisle repeatedly criticized federal regulators who for years had supposedly been keeping a close eye on the company.

TITLE: What you need to know about the new edit and unsend options for iMessage
SUMMARY: Apple has delivered on two of its most requested features: the ability to edit and unsend iMessages.

TITLE: Federal appeals court upholds controversial Texas social media law restricting content moderation
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court on Friday upheld a controversial Texas law that restricts the ability of Facebook, Twitter and YouTube to moderate content on their platforms, setting up a potential Supreme Court showdown while also renewing uncertainties about how tech platforms may operate in the state in the future.

TITLE: The 40-year evolution from :-) to 😂
SUMMARY: At 11:44 a.m. on September 19, 1982, Scott Fahlman made internet history by stitching together a colon, a hyphen and a close parenthesis.

TITLE: Why deleting something from the internet is 'almost impossible'
SUMMARY: Most people may live out their digital lives with the assumption they can delete their posts, messages and personal data from services whenever they choose. But a tech hearing this week threw that core assumption into question.

TITLE: Uber says hacker group Lapsus$ behind cybersecurity incident
SUMMARY: Uber has linked the cybersecurity incident it disclosed last week to hackers affiliated with the Lapsus$ gang, a group accused of numerous high-profile corporate data breaches. The company also said the attackers were able to download or access company Slack messages and invoice-related data from an internal tool.

TITLE: 'Grand Theft Auto' leaks emerge online after publisher hit by 'network intrusion'
SUMMARY: Rockstar Games confirmed on Monday that hackers had leaked some unreleased footage from its next iteration of the wildly popular "Grand Theft Auto" franchise.

TITLE: Twitter founder Jack Dorsey to be deposed in Twitter v. Musk case
SUMMARY: Twitter co-founder and former CEO Jack Dorsey will be questioned on Tuesday morning by lawyers for the company and Elon Musk as part of the court fight over their $44 billion acquisition deal, according to a notice of a deposition filed Monday.

TITLE: Here's why tech companies keep paying millions to settle lawsuits in Illinois
SUMMARY: Regulators have spent years trying to make big tech companies pay for the ways they harvest and, at times, abuse users' data. One state, meanwhile, is literally making them pay up — and pay out directly to consumers.

TITLE: Apple plans fix for bug that users say makes iPhone 14 Pro camera shake uncontrollably
SUMMARY: Apple said it is working on a software fix after some users who recently purchased an iPhone 14 Pro or iPhone 14 Pro Max reported their devices' rear-facing cameras shook "uncontrollably" and made strange noises when using social media apps.

TITLE: Twitter to depose Elon Musk next week
SUMMARY: Twitter is set to depose Elon Musk on Sept. 26 and 27 as part of ongoing litigation over their $44 billion acquisition deal, according to a court filing in the case.

TITLE: Crypto firm Wintermute hit by $160 million theft
SUMMARY: Hackers have stolen around $160 million worth of cryptocurrency from crypto market maker Wintermute, the company said Tuesday. The incident marks the latest in a growing list of large crypto thefts this year.

TITLE: FTC probes Amazon's $1.7 billion acquisition of Roomba maker iRobot
SUMMARY: The Federal Trade Commission is taking a closer look at Amazon's proposed acquisition of iRobot, the company that produces the Roomba series of automated vacuum cleaners, according to a financial disclosure on Tuesday.

TITLE: Saudi Arabia buys pair of SpaceX astronaut seats from Axiom
SUMMARY: Saudi Arabia is planning to launch two astronauts to the International Space Station aboard a space capsule from Elon Musk's SpaceX, becoming the latest Gulf nation to strengthen ties with private U.S. space companies, according to three people familiar with the arrangement.

TITLE: TikTok to require verification of political accounts and ban political fundraising
SUMMARY: TikTok has begun to require "mandatory verification" for political accounts based in the United States and will be prohibiting all political fundraising on its short-video platform, the company said Wednesday.

TITLE: What to know about the new Windows 11 update
SUMMARY: Nearly one year after Microsoft launched its flagship Windows 11, the tech giant has officially rolled out its first major update to the operating system.

TITLE: Florida asks Supreme Court to rule on its controversial social media law
SUMMARY: Florida has asked the Supreme Court to rule on whether states may force social media companies to host content they would rather remove — setting up a potential landmark battle over digital speech rights and content moderation that could reshape the country's relationship with the First Amendment.

TITLE: Twitch plans to crack down on gambling livestreams amid backlash
SUMMARY: Live-streaming giant Twitch on Tuesday said it will take additional steps to crack down on unlicensed gambling content on its platform after facing backlash from some of its top creators.

TITLE: Amazon's Bezos, Jassy must testify in FTC investigation
SUMMARY: Amazon founder Jeff Bezos and CEO Andy Jassy must testify in an ongoing Federal Trade Commission probe into whether the company misled people into subscribing to Amazon Prime and other services, the agency said Wednesday.

TITLE: Larry Page's electric air taxi startup is winding down
SUMMARY: Kittyhawk, the electric air taxi startup backed by Google co-founder Larry Page, announced Wednesday that it plans to "wind down" operations.

TITLE: The internet's new favorite video game is like 'Guitar Hero' but with trombones
SUMMARY: If you liked "Guitar Hero" but wished it had more brass instruments, you're in luck.

TITLE: Iran's sweeping internet blackouts are a serious cause for concern
SUMMARY: When Iranian authorities pulled the plug on the internet in 2019 amid anti-government protests, the international community struggled to track the civilian carnage that followed.

TITLE: This guy is using AI to make a movie — and you can help decide what happens next
SUMMARY: "Salt" resembles many science-fiction films from the '70s and early '80s, complete with 35mm footage of space freighters and moody alien landscapes. But while it looks like a throwback, the way it was created points to what could be a new frontier for making movies.

TITLE: Apple is making the iPhone 14 in India as China headaches mount
SUMMARY: Apple has started making its new iPhone 14 in India, as the technology giant looks to diversify its supply chain away from China.

TITLE: Twitter CEO to be deposed in lawsuit against Musk
SUMMARY: Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal will be deposed on Monday as part of the company's ongoing lawsuit to force Elon Musk to complete his $44 billion acquisition of the social media company.

TITLE: UK could fine TikTok $29 million over children's privacy concerns
SUMMARY: The UK said Monday it could impose a multimillion-dollar fine on TikTok after the government found the short-form video platform may have violated children's privacy.

TITLE: Twitter CEO and Elon Musk depositions did not begin Monday, despite earlier filings in acquisition dispute
SUMMARY: Billionaire Elon Musk and Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal did not sit for depositions Monday as part of an ongoing merger lawsuit despite earlier scheduling notices filed in a Delaware court, marking another twist in a closely watched case about the future of one of the world's most influential social media platforms.
For the first time in history, NASA is trying to change the motion of a natural celestial body in space and has successfully slammed a spacecraft into the asteroid Dimorphos.

TITLE: Meta shuts down covert influence campaigns it says were run from China and Russia
SUMMARY: Facebook parent company Meta announced Tuesday it had detected and shut down two separate networks of fake accounts engaged in covert influence operations run from China and Russia.

TITLE: Netflix is opening its own video game studio as part of latest pivot into gaming
SUMMARY: It began by mailing out DVDs, then evolved to become a production and streaming powerhouse. Now Netflix appears to be making its next big bet on the future of gaming.

TITLE: Alice, the first all-electric passenger airplane, takes flight
SUMMARY: The world's first all-electric passenger aircraft has successfully taken to the sky.

TITLE: Apple removes Russian social media giant VK from app store
SUMMARY: Apple has removed VKontakte, a top Russian social media platform, from its app store, according to the app's developer.

TITLE: Apple stock drops on concerns about iPhone 14 demand
SUMMARY: Shares of Apple fell 4% in early trading Wednesday amid concerns about demand for the company's latest lineup of iPhones.

TITLE: Amazon's $999 dog-like robot is getting smarter
SUMMARY: Amazon on Wednesday unveiled a collection of product updates that tie together its vast suite of services and help ensure it remains at the center of peoples' lives and homes.

TITLE: Google will make it easier to search for nearby soup dumplings, and tell you if they're spicy
SUMMARY: Google is making it easier to find specific dishes at nearby restaurants, whether it's an ahi tartare, soup dumplings, or something else entirely.

TITLE: Amazon pausing operations at some facilities as Hurricane Ian approaches Florida
SUMMARY: Amazon is temporarily pausing operations at some of its facilities as Hurricane Ian barrels towards Florida, the company confirmed to CNN on Wednesday.

TITLE: US defeats Russia in a battle to control the future of the global internet
SUMMARY: The United States has soundly defeated Russia in an election to control a United Nations body responsible for shaping global internet development, a contest viewed as geopolitically symbolic amid wider US-Russia tensions and an answer to fears of growing censorship online by authoritarian regimes.

TITLE: Google rolls out tool for users to request excluding search results that contain private information
SUMMARY: Google on Wednesday said it has begun rolling out an option for users to request excluding search results featuring their phone numbers and other sensitive personal information, potentially adding an extra layer of protection for private data online.

TITLE: Amazon raising hourly pay for warehouse and delivery workers
SUMMARY: Amazon on Wednesday said it is raising the average starting pay for its warehouse workers and delivery drivers to more than $19 an hour, up from $18 previously, at a time when union pushes continue to spread across several of its facilities.

TITLE: Out-of-service satellites must be removed within 5 years, FCC says
SUMMARY: Satellites that are no longer in service must get out of the sky far more quickly under a new rule adopted by US federal regulators Thursday — and it's all in the name of combating the garbage in Earth's orbit.

TITLE: California bars tech companies from complying with other states' abortion-related warrants
SUMMARY: California is attempting to stymie abortion prosecutions in other states by making it illegal for Silicon Valley giants and other businesses based in the Golden State to hand over the personal information of abortion-seekers to out-of-state authorities.

TITLE: Google is shutting down its gaming service Stadia
SUMMARY: Google plans to shut down its cloud gaming service Stadia in January, a little more than three years after it launched, citing lackluster demand from customers.

TITLE: Meta is using AI to generate videos from just a few words
SUMMARY: Artificial intelligence is getting better and better at generating an image in response to a handful of words, with publicly available AI image generators such as DALL-E 2 and Stable Diffusion. Now, Meta researchers are taking AI a step further: they're using it to concoct videos from a text prompt.

TITLE: Sandy Hook parent recounts years of harassment after Alex Jones called him a crisis actor
SUMMARY: In emotional testimony on Thursday, Robbie Parker, the parent of a Sandy Hook shooting victim, recounted the violent threats and harassment he and his family have suffered in the years since conspiracy theorist Alex Jones called him a crisis actor.

TITLE: Ex-eBay execs heading to prison for harassing couple behind newsletter
SUMMARY: Two former eBay Inc security executives were sentenced to prison on Thursday for carrying out a campaign to harass and intimidate a Massachusetts couple through threats and disturbing home deliveries after their online newsletter drew the ire of the company's then-CEO.

TITLE: Anyone can now use powerful AI tools to make images. What could possibly go wrong?
SUMMARY: If you've ever wanted to use artificial intelligence to quickly design a hybrid between a duck and a corgi, now is your time to shine.

TITLE: Elon Musk's texts show how his relationship with Twitter went sideways
SUMMARY: Days before publicly announcing his investment in Twitter, Elon Musk texted with Jack Dorsey. The former Twitter CEO suggested he no longer believed in the company he founded, according to new court filings in the legal battle between Musk and Twitter.

TITLE: Tesla AI Day: Here's what to expect
SUMMARY: Tesla will hold its second annual AI Day in Palo Alto, California, Friday evening. The six-hour event will include updates on Tesla's work in artificial intelligence, "Full Self-Driving," its supercomputer "Dojo" and maybe a humanoid robot, according to invitations posted online by Tesla supporters. The event is expected to be live-streamed.

TITLE: Tesla's AI Day is tonight. It may wow you -- or end with a gaffe
SUMMARY: Tesla will hold its second annual AI Day in Palo Alto, California, Friday evening. The six-hour event will include updates on Tesla's work in artificial intelligence, "Full Self-Driving," its supercomputer "Dojo" and maybe a humanoid robot, according to invitations posted online by Tesla supporters. The event is expected to be live-streamed.

TITLE: Why 'Ring Nation' may be the most dystopian show on TV
SUMMARY: Anyone watching the first episode of "Ring Nation" this week would have seen short clips of a man finding out his wife was pregnant with triplets, an uninvited iguana showing up at someone's front door and an unsuspecting teenage boy being chased down by a crane in his driveway.

TITLE: Firefly successfully launches unmanned rocket
SUMMARY: Texas-based commercial rocket company Firefly launched a rocket into space Friday morning, about a year after a previous attempt ended in an explosion.

TITLE: Amazon is always watching
SUMMARY: A TV that knows when you're in and out of the room. A gadget that monitors your breathing pattern while you sleep. An enhanced voice assistant tool that highlights just how much it knows about your everyday life.

TITLE: Elon Musk sparks backlash from Ukrainian officials with unsolicited 'peace' plan
SUMMARY: Elon Musk drew backlash on Monday from Ukrainian officials, including President Volodymyr Zelensky, for his unsolicited advice on how to bring about "peace" amid Russia's ongoing invasion of the country.

TITLE: Elizabeth Holmes' sentencing date has been pushed back
SUMMARY: Elizabeth Holmes, the founder of failed blood testing startup Theranos who was convicted of fraud earlier this year, may not be sentenced until next year after the judge in the case decided to allow a hearing later this month to address defense concerns about a key witness's testimony.

TITLE: Amazon debuts new shopping portal for customers on government assistance
SUMMARY: Amazon on Monday launched a new shopping portal called Amazon Access that is designed for shoppers receiving government assistance.

TITLE: Dream, the Minecraft-playing YouTube star, finally reveals his face
SUMMARY: Dream, a YouTube star with more than 30 million subscribers, has finally revealed his face after hiding behind a smiley-face mask for years.

TITLE: 'F--- off,' ambassador tells Elon Musk after unveiling Ukraine 'peace' plan
SUMMARY: Elon Musk drew backlash on Monday from Ukrainian officials, including President Volodymyr Zelensky, for his unsolicited advice on how to bring about "peace" amid Russia's ongoing invasion of the country.

TITLE: Apple is one step closer to being forced to ditch its Lightning charger in Europe
SUMMARY: The European Union is one step closer to forcing Apple and other electronics vendors to use a single charging standard for devices such as phones and tablets.

TITLE: Wrong place, wrong time: How things went so badly for Twitter's new CEO so quickly
SUMMARY: When Parag Agrawal took over as Twitter's CEO last November following cofounder Jack Dorsey's surprise resignation from the role, he was little known outside the company.

TITLE: Twitter stock surges on reports Elon Musk again proposes buying the company at full price
SUMMARY: Twitter stock was halted twice and rose around 13% in midday trading Tuesday following reports that Elon Musk has proposed to move forward with his deal to buy the company at the originally agreed upon price of $54.20 per share.

TITLE: Elon Musk again proposes buying Twitter at full price
SUMMARY: Elon Musk on Monday sent a letter to Twitter proposing to follow through with his deal to buy the company at the originally agreed upon price of $54.20, according to a securities filing on Tuesday.

TITLE: Micron to invest up to $100 billion to build chip factory in upstate New York
SUMMARY: Micron on Tuesday said it would invest up to $100 billion over the next two decades to build a massive semiconductor factory in upstate New York. The move comes in the wake of US government efforts to boost domestic chip production.

TITLE: Elon Musk's bumpy road to possibly owning Twitter: A timeline
SUMMARY: A board seat accepted and then rejected. A stunning $44 billion takeover offer with uncertain financing. And a surprise early morning tweet putting the deal on hold, temporarily.

TITLE: In major reversal, Elon Musk again proposes buying Twitter at full price
SUMMARY: Elon Musk on Monday sent a letter to Twitter proposing to follow through with his deal to buy the company at the originally agreed upon price of $54.20 per share, according to a securities filing on Tuesday.

TITLE: The White House released an 'AI Bill of Rights'
SUMMARY: The White House on Tuesday released a set of guidelines it hopes will spur companies to make and deploy artificial intelligence more responsibly and limit AI-based surveillance, despite the fact that there are few US laws compelling them to do so.

TITLE: Elon Musk may want a WeChat for the world, but it won't be easy to build
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is taking inspiration from China's top social media platform, WeChat, while planning a future for Twitter. And while he has shared very few details of his ambition for an app for everything, experts say it won't be easy to achieve.

TITLE: Elon Musk may want a WeChat for the world. It won't be easy to build
SUMMARY: Elon Musk is taking inspiration from China's top social media platform, WeChat, while planning a future for Twitter. And while he has shared very few details of his ambition for an app for everything, experts say it won't be easy to achieve.

TITLE: Musk deal could see Trump back on Twitter by midterms
SUMMARY: Elon Musk's decision this week to once again move forward with his deal to acquire Twitter could see the return to the platform of former President Donald Trump, once the world's most influential tweeter.

TITLE: Elon Musk's deposition in Twitter dispute postponed amid revived talks to complete acquisition
SUMMARY: Lawyers for Elon Musk and Twitter have agreed to postpone the Tesla CEO's deposition in the court fight over their $44 billion acquisition agreement, a source familiar with the negotiations told CNN. The decision comes as the two sides renew negotiations to complete the deal.

TITLE: Amazon plans to hire 150,000 workers ahead of holiday shopping season
SUMMARY: Amazon said Thursday it plans to hire 150,000 new employees across the United States to meet demand ahead of the busy holiday shopping season.

TITLE: Google unveils new Pixel 7 smartphones and first-ever Pixel smartwatch
SUMMARY: Google on Thursday unveiled its new Pixel 7 smartphone lineup and its first-ever Pixel smartwatch, packed with tracking and health features from its subsidiary Fitbit.

TITLE: Amazon suspends 50 workers who refused to work after warehouse fire
SUMMARY: Amazon suspended dozens of workers at its only unionized warehouse on Tuesday, one day after they organized a work stoppage following a fire at the facility.

TITLE: How Elon Musk could change Twitter
SUMMARY: Nearly three months after Elon Musk told Twitter he wanted out of his $44 billion agreement to buy the social media company, the Tesla CEO now once again wants to move forward with the deal.

TITLE: Jury finds former Uber security chief guilty of concealing data breach
SUMMARY: A San Francisco jury has found Uber Technologies Inc's former chief security officer Joseph Sullivan guilty of criminal obstruction for failing to report a 2016 cybersecurity incident to the authorities, a spokesperson from the Department of Justice confirmed on Wednesday.

TITLE: Elon Musk's Twitter acquisition isn't a done deal yet
SUMMARY: Elon Musk appears to be closer to completing his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter than at any point since he first said the deal was "on hold" nearly five months ago. But it's not a done deal yet.

TITLE: AMD sees lower Q3 revenue as PC market slump worse than expected
SUMMARY: Chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices Inc on Thursday provided third-quarter revenue estimates that fell well short of its previous forecast, citing lower-than-expected demand and significant inventory corrections across the personal computer market supply chain.

TITLE: Twitter lawyers raise doubts about Elon Musk closing the deal: 'Trust us,' they say, 'we mean it this time'
SUMMARY: Lawyers for Elon Musk have filed a motion to stay the legal proceedings in its dispute with Twitter and to remove from the court's calendar the trial that had been set to begin Oct. 17, noting "changed circumstances that have effectively mooted this action," according to a Thursday court filing.

TITLE: The Twitter-Musk trial is now on pause
SUMMARY: The judge overseeing the acquisition dispute between Elon Musk and Twitter on Thursday ruled to pause the legal proceedings until Oct. 28 following a request from the Tesla CEO, meaning the trial that was set to begin Oct. 17 will not go ahead as planned.

TITLE: AMD revenue warning signals deep chip slump; shares dive 4%
SUMMARY: Chipmaker Advanced Micro Devices Inc on Thursday provided third-quarter revenue estimates that were about a billion dollars less than previously forecast, signaling the chip slump could be much worse than expected.

TITLE: Biden signs order to implement EU-US data privacy framework
SUMMARY: President Joe Biden on Friday signed an executive order to implement a European Union-United States data transfer framework announced in March that adopts new American intelligence gathering privacy safeguards.

TITLE: The fate of Elon Musk's deal to buy Twitter now comes down to the money
SUMMARY: The countdown is now on for Elon Musk and Twitter to close their $44 billion acquisition deal by October 28 or be forced to again prepare for a trial after a judge agreed on Thursday pause the legal proceedings.

TITLE: Binance-linked blockchain hit by $570 million crypto theft
SUMMARY: Binance, which describes itself as the largest crypto exchange by trading volume, is the latest company to be impacted by a major theft this year.

TITLE: Elon Musk's unsolicited idea for Taiwan welcomed by Beijing, slammed in Taipei
SUMMARY: As tensions between China and Taiwan simmer at their highest point in decades, officials in both places have clashed in recent days over an unsolicited idea from billionaire Elon Musk.

TITLE: Elon Musk commissioned this bot analysis in his fight with Twitter. Now it shows what he could face if he takes over the platform
SUMMARY: Spam and fake accounts are more prevalent on Twitter than on comparable social platforms, according to a data analysis firm hired by Elon Musk as part of his legal battle with Twitter.

TITLE: Meta's newest VR headset is impressive. Here's why you probably won't buy it
SUMMARY: Meta's newest virtual-reality headset, the Meta Quest Pro, is a slick, powerful device. It can display text and fine details in VR, making it possible to read even small type with ease. It can track your eyes and facial features, giving you a sense of connection with other people in virtual spaces: If you arch your eyebrows or they puff up their cheeks in real life, so too will the VR avatars. And it can be used as a mixed-reality headset, showing you a view of the world around you in color while letting you interact with digital objects — whether you're painting on an ersatz easel or putting on a faux mini-golf course.

TITLE: TikTok wants to open warehouses
SUMMARY: While seemingly every social media app is copying TikTok, TikTok now appears to be copying Amazon's playbook.

TITLE: Amazon Labor Union faces next showdown in upstate New York
SUMMARY: In April, a grassroots worker group made history by gaining enough votes to form the first US union at an Amazon warehouse in Staten Island, New York, in what was widely viewed as a "David vs. Goliath" battle. The next month, that same group, the Amazon Labor Union (ALU), fell short at a smaller facility across the street.

TITLE: Microsoft unveils $4,299 Surface desktop computer
SUMMARY: Microsoft's most expensive Surface device is about to get even pricier.

TITLE: SpaceX books another ride for a millionaire around the moon
SUMMARY: Dennis Tito, a US millionaire who previously paid his way to the International Space Station in 2001, and his wife, Akiko, plan to take a lunar expedition that will last roughly a week, according to SpaceX.

TITLE: Google approves Truth Social for the Google Play Store
SUMMARY: Truth Social, the social media app backed by former President Donald Trump, has been approved for the Google Play Store, Google said Wednesday.

TITLE: Apple store workers in Oklahoma to vote on labor union
SUMMARY: Apple workers in Oklahoma City are set to vote this week on whether to form the second-ever labor union at one of the tech giant's US stores.

TITLE: Federal appeals court pauses Texas social media law's enforcement amid looming Supreme Court petition
SUMMARY: A federal appeals court has agreed to suspend enforcement of Texas' social media law restricting content moderation, in the face of a looming request by tech industry groups for the Supreme Court to review the case.

TITLE: FCC could ban all new purchases of Huawei and ZTE telecom gear
SUMMARY: The US government is poised to ban all purchases of new telecom equipment from Huawei and ZTE, two Chinese technology giants, in an expanding crackdown against perceived national security risks from China, according to a report by Axios.

TITLE: Elon Musk is under federal investigation over his Twitter deal, Twitter claims
SUMMARY: Federal authorities are investigating Elon Musk in connection with his $44 billion acquisition of Twitter, the social media platform said in a court filing Thursday.

TITLE: What to do with your old phones, gadgets and other e-waste
SUMMARY: In the past two months, Apple, Google and Samsung have all unveiled their newest smartphones and other devices with the goal of getting consumers to upgrade ahead of the holidays. But in the process, these and other companies may also be adding to a growing problem: electronic waste.

TITLE: Workers at second Apple store vote to join union
SUMMARY: Apple workers in Oklahoma City have voted to form the second-ever labor union at one of the company's US stores, in the latest sign that organizing efforts are gaining traction inside and outside the tech and retail industries.

TITLE: How a 51-year-old celebrity hacker upended one of the world's most influential social networks
SUMMARY: When Peiter Zatko joined Twitter as head of security in late 2020 at the urging of founder and then-CEO Jack Dorsey, he was surprised by what he discovered. Twitter, a social network with hundreds of millions of users, "was over a decade behind industry security standards," he later testified.

TITLE: Kanye West to acquire conservative social media platform Parler
SUMMARY: Kanye West is acquiring Parler, the alternative social media platform favored by many conservatives.

TITLE: With product innovation lagging, Silicon Valley bets on a fresh coat of paint
SUMMARY: When Google unveiled its new Pixel 7 smartphone lineup earlier this month, the devices looked largely the same as the year prior. But there was at least one subtle change: the colors.
